meanings.definition: To damage or spoil the appearance of
meanings.sent1: I accidentally marred the table when I spilled paint on it.
meanings.sent2: The scratch on the car's door will mar its resale value.
meanings.sent3: My attempt at painting the wall ended up being a mar on the room's decor.
meanings.sent4: The graffiti on the historic building marred its beauty and history.
meanings.sent5: The permanent marker marred the clean white paper with a big blot.

meanings.definition: A mark or blemish on a surface
meanings.sent1: There was a small mar on the mirror that caught my eye.
meanings.sent2: The antique vase had a tiny mar on its delicate surface.
meanings.sent3: The cake was perfect except for the mar from the baker's fingerprint.
meanings.sent4: The old painting had a mysterious mar that added character to it.
meanings.sent5: The new phone had a noticeable mar on its screen, affecting its display.

meanings.definition: To impair the quality or perfection of
meanings.sent1: The loud noise from the construction site marred the peaceful atmosphere.
meanings.sent2: A single mistake can mar the entire project's success.
meanings.sent3: The rain threatened to mar our outdoor picnic plans.
meanings.sent4: The negative comments online can mar a person's self-esteem.
meanings.sent5: The lack of sleep can mar your ability to focus and perform well.

meanings.sent1: The deep mar on his face was a constant reminder of the accident.
meanings.sent2: She covered the mar on her arm with a long-sleeved shirt.
meanings.sent3: The mar on the statue made it look like it had a story to tell.
meanings.sent4: The old tree bore the mar of lightning strikes over the years.
meanings.sent5: The mar on the antique furniture hinted at its long history and previous owners.
